publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-8147 Linda Fabiani: Theatre Nemo Wins Again—That the Parliament congratulates Theatre Nemo on winning the Social Economy Organisation of the Year Award from the Glasgow West Regeneration Agency on 4 March 2011; notes the work that Theatre Nemo does with people with chronic mental health problems in psychiatric hospitals and prisons and with those people left without care in the community whom the Scottish Prison Service, NHS and local authorities cannot tackle on their own; recognises the value of the work carried out in partnership with HMP Barlinnie, providing creative, artistic programmes to mentally ill and vulnerable prisoners, giving confidence and helping to build the type of social skills that are known to reduce reoffending by offering alternative, positive life choices to repeat offenders with mental health issues, and wishes all involved with Theatre Nemo continuing success.
S3M-8147 Theatre Nemo Wins Again (lodged on 11 March 2011) Jamie Hepburn*

S3M-8147 Theatre Nemo Wins Again (lodged on 11 March 2011) Patricia Ferguson*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Christina McKelvie*, Robin Harper*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Stewart Maxwell*, John Wilson*, Rob Gibson*, Bill Kidd*
S3M-8147 Theatre Nemo Wins Again (lodged on 11 March 2011) Maureen Watt*, Aileen Campbell*, Anne McLaughlin*
S3M-8147 Theatre Nemo Wins Again (lodged on 11 March 2011) Stuart McMillan*

S3M-8147 Linda Fabiani: Theatre Nemo Wins Again—That the Parliament congratulates Theatre Nemo on winning the Social Economy Organisation of the Year Award from the Glasgow West Regeneration Agency on 4 March 2011; notes the work that Theatre Nemo does with people with chronic mental health problems in psychiatric hospitals and prisons and with those people left without care in the community whom the Scottish Prison Service, NHS and local authorities cannot tackle on their own; recognises the value of the work carried out in partnership with HMP Barlinnie, providing creative, artistic programmes to mentally ill and vulnerable prisoners, giving confidence and helping to build the type of social skills that are known to reduce reoffending by offering alternative, positive life choices to repeat offenders with mental health issues, and wishes all involved with Theatre Nemo continuing success. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Patricia Ferguson, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Christina McKelvie, Robin Harper, Hugh O’Donnell, Stewart Maxwell, John Wilson, Rob Gibson, Bill Kidd, Maureen Watt, Aileen Campbell, Anne McLaughlin, Stuart McMillan
